attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Ban overseas investment in UK property
attributes.background: The UK / London has been experiencing large scale foreign investment in the UK residential housing market. Foreign investment is endemic causing overpriced properties to be built, sold or left empty etc.
attributes.additional_details: Research carried out by the BBC into investors from the Russian Federation, China, Hong Kong, Africa etc. shows buying property in the UK has reached epidemic proportions. Housing bought by non-UK residents could be used as a bank or to hide money (laundering). Wholesale, buying off plan of entire blocks of flats or buildings is causing the UK housing market to spiral out of control. The UK Government should adopt the New Zealand policy of banning non NZ residents from buying propriety.

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: Make it that front number plates do not have to be shown on a motor vehicle
attributes.background: Make it so that on a motor vehicle that you don’t have to display a front number plate.

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: Stop companies asking for payment details for free trials of services.
attributes.background: For Free trials of services companies request payment details for the said trials. Failure to terminate at the end of a trial would normal mean services are charged for the next billing period. They should provide a option to terminate at point of  registering for free trail or terminate at expiry
attributes.additional_details:
Netflix
Linked in 
NOW TV  and so many more
They are all are relying on some income from those that forget to terminate. A free trial in good faith would not require payment method. It should be illegal not to auto terminate or give the option to terminate at the point of registering

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Install security checkpoints at every underground transport station in the U.K.
attributes.background: Given the increasing prevalence of terror attacks in major U.K. cities, discuss reforms of national transport security policy. Initially install baggage scanners and metal detectors at underground stations and conduct random searches (not based on profile) of passengers crossing station checkpoints.
attributes.additional_details: Global cities more densely populated than London require passengers to place large items on scanners before proceeding to trains and metros. Metal detectors are also used to detect weapons and explosives. It is currently too easy to bring dangerous articles into confined stations in the U.K. wherein likelihood of injury and fatality from terror incidents increases. Requiring random searches of passengers and staff entering these stations could also mitigate the possibility of unfair profiling.

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.

attributes.action: Move PMQ's to prime time on Tuesdays
attributes.background:
Prime Minister's Questions should be moved from 12pm on Wednesday to Tuesday evenings.

This will increase the amount of people able to watch PMQ's and participate in democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest Tuesdays as the best day as there aren't other popular shows on on a Tuesday, increasing the audience.

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry into the National problem of Paedophile grooming gangs
attributes.background: Paedophile grooming gangs seem endemic nationwide in the UK it is apparent some are possibly racially motivated & the UK public deserves protection from this and an inquiry should investigate fully if race & culture is a factor and if sentencing is adequate and investigate if culture influences rape
attributes.additional_details: Rotheram, Luton. Oxford, Huddersfield, Sunderland and numerous other towns counties cities and rural areas have seen an increase in paedophilia grooming gangs of various race colour and religions in the UK many within religious sectors and the inquiry needs to focus on culture religion and if many of these attacks are focused on a particular race and if culltural is an influence in these attacks.Sentencing never seems severe enough and local authorities seem to make the same mistakes.

attributes.action: Abolish minimum income floor for the self employed zero contracts and disabled.
attributes.background: The requirement of MIF removes flexibility for the disabled, zero hours contracts and self employed workers, which by nature can be seasonal and erratic.It undermines the contribution that disabled and self employed people make and throttles entrepreneurs who could ultimately go on to employ others.
attributes.additional_details:
An employee earning £12000 a year from employment is topped up with approx £500 of extra support in a month. If a self-employed worker earning £12,000 a year earns an extra £200 in a given month it would reduce their entitlement by £90, while taking home £200 less in another month would increase their entitlement by just £5.How is this fair?

Source: Resolution Foundation

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Reduce the price of British citizenship for children from £973 to less than £600
attributes.background: The price for British citizenship for children is currently £973, and without this they can't vote or claim student loans. The Home Office makes over £500 profit for each application and this makes many families unable to afford citizenship. The government are putting a price on democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
These children will, later in life, pay taxes as a normal citizen would, but will not benefit in the same way.

As well as this, over 3,000 children that do apply, are denied the citizenship and not refunded the £973 fee.

The right to these has been given to these children by parliament, but currently they are being sold by the home office.

To find out more about the issue, you can read this article:

https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/534zx8/the-british-born-kids-who-cant-afford-to-be-british

attributes.action: Restore Nursing bursaries
attributes.background:
The shortage of nursing staff is adversely affecting patient care 
Scrapping nursing bursaries has affected the recruitment of nurses
Nursing is one of the most valuable professions , and should be supported in every way possible

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in schools as part of the RE curriculum
attributes.background: Paganism is still being ignored by the curriculum despite being one of the oldest religions in the world and a religion from which many newer religions have borrowed traditions. Paganism is at the heart of British history and should be taught to allow understanding of our heritage to UK children.

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Government facilitate a cross party group of MP’s to assess the needs of the NHS
attributes.background: Suggest political parties stop using the problems the NHS faces for political gain and to work together to improve it for patients and employees of the service. To co-operate with each other to find the best solutions to maintaining a sustainable high level of health care for everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
The group could analyse other successful health care schemes, their procedures, expenditure measured against results. Do hospital and GP procedures need to change?

Is the British health care system working so well that it only needs more funds? If so, how can further funds be raised without increasing the national debt? All of these questions will be more credible to all political parties if answered by a cross party group of MP’s.

attributes.action: To make it law that all public places to have a defibrillator on site
attributes.background: On the 23rd a December I was at a non league football match, a spectator suffered a cardiac arrest. The club had a defibrillator on site and that saved the mans life.
attributes.additional_details: I was going make the petition about non league football grounds having a defibrillator, I have decided to make it all public places. For example every supermarket , football ground and shopping centre must have a defibrillator.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Save Old Heath Saxon Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: Old Heath Saxon Church mentioned in the Doomsday Book is going to be demolished for HS2 ROUTE. Save our Saxon history, we wouldn't knock down Stonehenge or other historic structures. Please don't let this happen.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 proposed route

attributes.action: Make it a criminal,not civil, offence to take part in an unauthorised encampment
attributes.background: Many UK citizens are regularly subjected to anti-social behaviour by people who make camp in their neighbourhood whilst on their travels. Invariably when they move on they leave a considerable amount of mess and damage behind which costs the land owners a significant amount of money to address.
attributes.additional_details: On more than one occasion our local school have been required to pay many thousands of pounds to clean up the children's playing field after travellers had left. There was national outrage recently when travellers left 600 ton of rubbish in a field in Uxbridge. They were not even issued with a ticket for littering! Anyone taking part in an unauthorised encampment must be held legally responsible for leaving the site in the same state as they found it and also prosecuted in the courts.

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Increase school funding in Hackney schools back to what it was.
attributes.background: Schools in Hackney are now really struggling in buying new resources especially that the new GCSE, A-Level and BTEC curriculum has been introduced. Schools need the resources, and they aren’t able to fund them.

attributes.action: Give equal state pension to every state pensioner
attributes.background: Back in April 2016 the government introduced a new state pension of £155/week for state pensioners but if you were already a state pensioner i.e. pre April 2016 your state pension remained the same £125 per week surely this cannot be fair or just why should any state pensioner get £30 a week more.
attributes.additional_details: I am very vexed about this scenario if we were talking of a few pence but this is serious money approx. £30 per week or £120 per month I feel the government has created a two tier pension scheme one for rich state pensioners post April 2016 and one for poor state pensioners pre April 2016 I feel this is totally unfair as I am on the pre 2016 rate after having paid in over 38 years of national insurance contributions why should I receive less money per month than a "new pensioner".

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action: Carbon monoxide detectors in student accommodation and lettings
attributes.background:
My daughter has just moved into a student flat were we found no carbon monoxide detectors, which I thought would be a legal requirement. But after speaking to the letting company they told me that they there's no legal requirement for them.
We all know the consequences of a carbon monoxide leak...
attributes.additional_details:
This is what I received from Save the Student when I put the question to them regarding the law...
They are only legally required for any room containing a solid fuel burning appliance, and not for Gas appliances. However gas boilers can emit carbon monoxide, and the government say "we would expect and encourage reputable landlords to ensure that working carbon monoxide alarms are installed in rooms with gas boilers". So we advise you put strong pressure on the agent to do the right thing.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis oil for medicinal usage.
attributes.background:
Cannabis Oil is one of the oldest medicines known to Man. There has been numerous studies completed proving that cannabis oil can assist treating epilepsy, insomnia and even treat people suffering from cancer. 

Cannabidiol (CBD) can be developed for use with low THC content therefor no high...
attributes.additional_details:
Scientists are rapidly discovering more and more about the rather amazing abilities of the cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant. Most of them have shown therapeutic value, as have the terpenes, which give the plant its distinct odors. There are over 125 terpenes and over 80 cannabinoids in cannabis and each strain has its own unique blend that create its distinct effects. 
CBD also has the effect of reducing the undesirable effects of high-THC cannabis, such as anxiety and paranoia.

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Vote for whether there should be another EU referendum
attributes.background: HM Government says that if there is another referendum, then Democracy is broken. Therefore, I am calling for a vote on whether another referendum should take place, which means Democracy is not broken as the people have chosen to have another referendum if it is voted for.
attributes.additional_details: This means that the government must hold another referendum as the people of the nation voted for it, and must not neglect democracy. Lies were made in the campaign for Brexit, and politicians have not been held accounted for that. I personally believe that false hope does not represent democracy and there was no transparency. Furthermore, the people did not know what they voted for and they have the right to vote again, now they understand consequences. You must ask the people to vote again.

attributes.action: Intervene in the slaughter of stray dogs in Russia preceding the 2018 World Cup.
attributes.background: The 2018 FIFA Football World Cup will take place in Russia in June and July. In an attempt to “ensure security and a pleasant stay” and “provide a good image” for visitors, thousands of stray cats and dogs and even birds in host cities are being killed.
attributes.additional_details:
Russia lacks a humane system of shelters, food and medical support for homeless cats and dogs. However, contracts worth $1.95million have been signed in host cities to kill the animals rather than set up shelters or provide spay/neuter and vaccinations programmes. 

Russia must withdraw all contracts and cancel planned slaughter of hundreds of thousands of animals.  

WE ASK OUR GOVERNMENT: Contact the Russian Government and demand the passing of animal protection laws and redirect any foreign aid to support humane solutions to remove stray animals from the streets.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/bloodyFIFA2018/

attributes.action: Make Paper Carrier Bags & Packaging compulsory for shops and manufacturers
attributes.background: The Government introduced the 5p charge on carrier bags in shops they are now planning to implement it across all. BUT what they should be doing is stopping plastic being used- Paper Carrier Bags and packaging is far better for us and can be recycled easily this would be Enviromentally safer.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic carrier bags get into the water supply and sea causing harm to wild life and also in long run the food chain - Paper can be made to be biodegradable so if dumped would not cause harm to wild life and so would not harm us - let the UK 🇬🇧 be a world leader in starting to bring back the classic Paper Carrier Bags for shops and then front leader in Paper or biodegradable card for packaging for manufacturers

attributes.action: Allow more people of non British Nationality/Citizenship join the British Army
attributes.background: I am not of British decent my dream would be to join the British Army as I have been living here in Scotland for 11 years and want to serve what i class as my country right now members of the Commonwealth and with British Citizenship can serve So me being Polish makes joining a real issue, Thanks.
attributes.additional_details: The last calls for Polish Citizens to be allowed to join the Forces was in 2008 but nothing came from so when i found out about this when i was doing me research I was really disappointed so i applied for a Citizenship but that also got knocked back making my dreams feel impossible to achieve so i would like peoples help in making my dreams come true and i'm sure many other people are having the same issue as me they love the country the live in but are not allowed to serve in its Armed Forces

attributes.action: Require that sheltered accommodation residents are checked daily
attributes.background: A very close friend was lying unconscious while she lived in sheltered accommodation. She was not checked on which means many elderly people are being left unconscious which may then result in death.
attributes.additional_details: My friend is still in intensive care.

attributes.action: Ban anti bird spikes from being installed on trees and other natural roosts.
attributes.background:
Residents in a wealthy area of Bristol have installed the spikes on the roosting branches of some trees to protect their cars from bird poo.
UK Bird populations are in great decline. Heinous practices like this is wrong on so many levels.
attributes.additional_details:
It was with great outrage and disgust that I saw this post on Twitter and Had to petition against this practice. 

Photo via @BenjaminRamm

https://mobile.twitter.com/i/moments/943141137761619968?t=1&cn=ZmxleGlibGVfcmVjcw%3D%3D&refsrc=email&iid=41c3015d379349e686e892f1d1521bd3&uid=2754606344&nid=244+273027072

attributes.action: Cap train fares to coincide with the National Minimal Wage
attributes.background: Train fares have recently gone up by 1/3. This increase has resulted in the majority of hard working Britain's finding that they are paying more for their train journey then what they are being paid an hour.
attributes.additional_details: For example an individual over the age of 18 will pay £7.90 for a 22 minute train ride to work where they will be paid £5.60 for an hours of hard work. This results in a loss of over £2! This increase is barbaric and train fares should be capped in line with the National Minimal Wage to ensure everyone is able to access transport to work!

attributes.action: Ban Hate Groups, Britain First & English Defence League!
attributes.background: Under the Terrorism Act 2000, the Home Secretary may proscribe(ban) an organisation if (s)he believes it is concerned in terrorism, and it is proportionate to do. We call upon the Home Secretary to add Britain First and the EDL to the list of proscribed organisations.
attributes.additional_details:
This same terrorism act declares "acts of terrorism" as "acts of persons acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of Her Majesty's government in the United Kingdom or any other government de jure or de facto."
We believe Britain First are advocates of racially motivated violence and this is well documented with violence at rallies and unfettered hate speech.
Britain does not tolerate this when it is religiously motivated, why should we tolerate it when it is founded on 'Nationalism'.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to £2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Make Financial Studies a core subject on the National Curriculum at Key Stage 4
attributes.background: Sometimes we all question some of the things we had to learn at school, like pi or algebra, and how they have had no relevance in our lives at all. Some of us may have achieved an A* in our English Literature exam, but Shakespeare will never help you understand how to get a mortgage or manage debt.
attributes.additional_details: Debt and money issues are a rising concern for young people in the UK, with those aged 16 to 24 having the highest individual debt to income ratio amongst all over age groups (Household debt inequalities dataset, ONS, April 2016). School should be preparing our children for the real world, and I call on the UK Government to make financial studies a core subject in our National Curriculum, so that our children can leave school with the best chances of being financially stable and debt free.

attributes.action: Include under 25s in the National Living Wage & adopt the real living wage.
attributes.background:
The Govt's National Living Wage is currently set at £7.50/hr for people aged 25 & over. However this doesn't apply to under 25s, some of whom can be on wages as low as £5.60/hr. We call on the Govt to:
- Include under 25s
- Adopt the real living wage (£10.20 in London, £8.75 in the rest of the UK)
attributes.additional_details: As the Living Wage Week comes to end, we believe that workers in Britain deserve a proper wage rise. With the Chancellor preparing to announce his first budget of this Parliament, we must put pressure on the Govt to adopt the real living wage released by the Living Wage Foundation. A report released by KPMG highlighted that 5.5 million people still earn less than the real Living Wage rates. If you believe that all workers deserve a fair day’s pay for a fair day’s work, please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Ban the use of lead in all shotgun cartridges
attributes.background: The lead in shotgun cartridges is poisoning our environment. This leads to the slow death of many species of birds. Albeit shot birds that are consumed by predatory birds and scavengers or birds ingesting them mistakenly taken as grit. There are many alternatives available to use.
